titleStmt.title: James F. Robinson, Secretary of State, Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7741

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
JAMES F. ROBINSON,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH,
To all whom these Presents shall come, Greeting:

Know Ye, That D. C. Wickliffe Esq having been duly elected appointed (by and with the advice & consent of the Senate) -- Secretary of State -- for the State of Kentucky I hereby invest him with full power and authority to execute and discharge the duties of said office according to law: And to have and to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments thereto legally appertaining, for an during the term prescribed by law.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent, and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 19th day of August, in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and 62, and in the 71st year of the Commonwealth.

J F Robinson
BY THE GOVERNOR:
Nat Gaither, Secretary of State.
Commonwealth Office -- WM. H. HUGHES, State Printer.
Clerks office of Court of Appeal -- August 19/62
I certify that D. C. Wicklliffe this day qualified to this commission as Secretary of State -- according to law

A H.
Larue County -- C. Cot.

Secretary of State
D. C. Wickliffe
Appointment and Oath
Aug 19th 1862
